Dinguerie m√™me si la derni√®re mission est cancer

Visually the best in Half-Life 2's run, and offers a nice change of scenery from the drab brown of City 17. Probably the most story rich of Half-Life 2's run, exploring more about the resistance, making connections to another Valve title that I won't mention in case you somehow never played these two games, providing an air of mystery about the G-Man that was noticeably absent from Episode 1, and leaving us all on a cliff hanger that to this day that still leaves us, over a decade later, scratching our heads wondering what they could be doing next. 

Half-Life 2 focused a lot on how the world ended up the way it did during Gordon's absence, Episode 1 focused more on what was going on in the present as the resistance began their uprising, and Episode 2 focuses more on what the future of the series could potentially hold, unforeseen consequences and all.

Like the other two in this series, of course I'd recommend Episode 2. Just play through the others first. 



Also, gnome.
Longer than episode one with a bigger and better story and environment.  Leaves you wanting more, much much more.  One of the better installments in terms writing 9.8/10
porfa porfa ya sacen el 3 plis se lo suplico
Trying to get the achievements in this game instills a feral, unquenchable rage within my otherwise kindly character, not matched by any other. The actual game is pretty swag though.

Half-life 2: Episode Two is a great follow-up to Episode One, and also more inventive than Episode One. There's new enemies, new forest ambience that I really like, also more heavy driven narrative story. I really hope that I still alive to witness Half-Life 3 or at least episode three lol. 8/10 for the score, of course, very recommended if you enjoy Half-Life series.

While this game is good and fun i think it's highly overrated for what it is. 
The gunplay is standard Half-Life/Counter Strike.
The graphics are good for their time.
The physics are THE highlight in this game ofc.
But the story... i don't know if they tried to take themselves too seriously or not. I am probably too much into sci-fi but this game never hit me as anything more than, well , mediocre. I'm gonna get flak for this but i guess people haven't ever read Sci-fi books or watched old films before playing this to realize its not even original or even great.
Also cliffhangers are a marketing strategy (especially in this case) and sadly here it worked like a charm.

Still, as a package the game is good for what it is. If you want fun with gunplay and GMOD physics this is your go-to.
good story but way the games in chapter end (like end forme ) is like openwold

More inventive than Episode One, I love the hunters.
Now we just need Episode Three lol

please stay away from this one at all cost - you might've played the previous ones and want to continue the story, but if you are planning to pay full price for this one - dont - on modern hardware it will crash and valve will never patch the crashes - the half life seriens is dead and valve isnt planning on doing anything about it - this game is highly unstable on modern hardware - just save the money for something better than that -.-

Great follow-up to Episode One, the change in scenery to the more open forests is really fun.  It feels like they are really pushing the story forward too with the heavier narrative elements weaved in. The set pieces are the best of the series too. Love the tavern defense and final defense parts, they are paced so perfectly.

Uscir√† mai Half-Life 3? Questo √® il dilemma che accompagna da molti anni tutti i fan della saga e gli appassionati di videogiochi. Nell'attesa ho voluto rigiocare i capitoli precedenti e quindi anche Episode Two. Una meravigliosa espansione, che introduce un paio di nuovi nemici e va a limare il comparto tecnico e l'IA. Ma quello che rende questa espansione degna di nota, √® lo sviluppo della trama e le situazioni che ci troveremo ad affrontare strada facendo. Il mondo di gioco, alcune battaglie memorabili e diversi colpi di scena, sono sempre perfettamente cadenzati. In Episode Two infatti si raggiungono picchi di spettacolarit√† a pi√π riprese e l'azione √® sempre al massimo. Resta solo l'amaro in bocca per un finale assolutamente aperto e che, speriamo presto, possa avere seguito con un nuovo capitolo canonico della serie.

Definitely the better of the two episodes
After the events of Episode One, Episode Two is somewhat better because it's longer and actually kills important characters...

This episode is much better than the first one. I love the stylistic change from fun, but repeatable old town and gloomy canals of HL2:E1 to forests and roads, spaces with a lot of free air to breath yet saturated with dangerous enemies. Episode 2 in some way is very similar to the original HL2, but it brings so many new things to the table and they ultimately make it look like a stand alone, full-flegged Half Life title. The story is as always on point and it's such a shame that Valve decided not to continue the creation of Episode 3. With that being said, this game is basically what people love in HL2 and it's definetely worth playing til this day, despite of never coming solution. ùüµ/ùü≠ùü¨

Although this game can be played on its own, the story continues after half life 2 DLC 1.  The story is still good after so many years.

There are three challenging achievements in this game.  Little rocket man, neighbourhood watch and get some grub.  It may take several attempts for these achievements.
Half life 2 ep 2 is a fun add on to half life 2. and hl2 ep2 has a big twist and cliff hanger at the end and its a shame that theres no HL3 (besides Half life Alyx)

[h1]¬øD√≥nde est√° el Episodio 3?[/h1]

Despu√©s de HL2 y el fraude del Episodio 1, HL2 Episodio 2 nos ofrece el mismo mundo que ya conocemos, pero con m√°s acci√≥n, y algunas mejoras que hacen que merezca la pena jugarlo.

Al contrario que el Ep1, este episodio se atreve a innovar un poco y nos encontramos con nuevos enemigos y escenarios distintos.
Visualmente es mejor que los anteriores. Y a nivel de ritmo, las fases son bastante emocionantes la mayor parte del tiempo, y la duraci√≥n total del juego es correcta.
No supone tanta novedad como el primer HL2, pero a√∫n as√≠ sigue sorprendiendo.

Hay algunas decisiones menores que no entender√© como que ¬øc√≥mo se justifica que empieces cada nuevo episodio sin armas? ¬øSe ha estrellado el tren y de repente has perdido todo lo que llevabas?
O que introduzcan un claro tutorial al final de partida casi, de c√≥mo disparar unas bombas a los zancudos. ¬øEs que no hemos aprendido nada de c√≥mo introducir las mec√°nicas al jugador?

Lo peor y por lo que se merece un negativo: deja la historia completamente abierta. Incluso los comentarios de los desarrolladores mencionan que se terminar√° en el episodio 3, pero este se cancel√≥, y mucho me temo que no lo veremos jam√°s y no veremos c√≥mo acaba la historia.

Si te gust√≥ Half-Life 2, muy posiblemente te guste este tambi√©n. Pero ten en cuenta que si te interesa la historia, el juego se queda completamente a medias.
Like every Half Life game, you will enjoy it. Fun time, cool environments, unique characters, and unparalleled gameplay!
Gnome achievement first try, too ez

This episode is the better of the two it has more open locations, is longer but has a cliffhanger ending.

WHERE HL3 VALVE??

A welcome continuation of the Half Life series, I still enjoy playing this game. The story is still compelling and relevant to events of the original Half Life. Combat is challenging without being ridiculously so, and the variety of weapons is still good - the gravity gun being my favourite. I do miss the lab setting and sense of discovery that was so central to the original HL, but here the environments are larger and still offer plenty of opportunity to explore.

A great follow up to the already titular Half Life 2 and Half Life 2 Episode 1. 
Lengthwise, it is longer than Episode 1, yet still shorter than the main game; but I really enjoyed every second of it. No new additions to the game were made, except just some new enemies, a goddamn gno... Gnome Chomsky, where are you heading at? I NEED YOU IN THE ROCKET!

The Hunters are really a way to challenge the players, as these are the toughest enemies yet beside Striders and Gunships. Alyx plays a much bigger role now, if we consider her role from Half Life: Alyx to be canon.
Otherwise, just another episode with Half Life 2 formula.
In all seriousness, the last section was difficult and fun.
Sad that the last episode was cancelled.
101 Chomskis out of 99 Hunters.
